fields.description:
It is very easy for an admin to go into project settings and assign the correct users to the Project User role, Project Lead, Project Authority role etc, which is great.
However, the display of these project users, leads etc does not allow you to see all users at once, and non-admins cannot access the project settings.
I would like anyone to be able to view a list of users in the various project roles easily. For example, it would be great if I could export the list to word/pdf, or display it on a confluence page with a macro. [There is the User List macro for jira user groups, but nothing for project roles]
fields.summary: List of Project Users and Roles - Better

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding attachments to an issue, using the new issue view, the attached files(in this case I used images) 1.png, 2.png, 3.png, and 4.png. The images attached to an issue(new issue view) were not keeping the filename order.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # First I placed all 4 attachments to the Jira issue and even having the names as 1.png, 2.png, 3.png, and 4.png the order was not kept. We can see the correct numeric order(alphabetical order) for the first second(s) and then the order is switched. [^Order switched - List view.mp4]

h3. Expected Results
 * In the old issue view the order is correct and logical;   !attachments_old_issue_view.png!

h3. Actual Results

In the *new issue view* is where the problem happens and there is not apparently permanent fixing, as even ordering it from the list view and refreshing the page would bring the attachments out of order again;

!attachments_new_issue_view.png!
h3. Workaround

The known workaround to this is by adding the files one by one to keep the order, or by using the list view and sorting the attachments by name, size, or date.

[^List view.mp4]
fields.summary: Ability to keep attachments chronological order, or filename order in new issue view

fields.description: When viewing the [https://site.atlassian.net/jira/boards] list, I want to filter the list by location, so that I can see all the boards associated with a project in one place, to make it easier to clean up unused boards.  Sorting by location would be good too, or a view by project.
fields.summary: As a site admin, I want to see all the boards associated with a project in one place

fields.description:
When trying to create differents priority categories for different projects, I came across a blocker.  I saw in the community that Jira has an option to create a Priority Scheme and assign them to a specific project, but I cannot see that option in the Cloud.

On this community question, it looks like the answer was just "we won't build it": [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-can-I-access-to-the-create-Priority-Scheme/qaq-p/800016?tempId=eyJvaWRjX2NvbnNlbnRfbGFuZ3VhZ2VfdmVyc2lvbiI6IjIuMCIsIm9pZGNfY29uc2VudF9ncmFudGVkX2F0IjoxNjE4NTE0ODk5NTAxfQ%3D%3D#U1665055]

 

How this would be helpful: 
 * For some of our Kanban Boards that are simple tasks we use a P0, P1, P2, etc. prioritization to help identify the deadline associated with each. 
 * We would love to use build Prioritization Levels only for certain boards and use the standard "Urgent, High, Normal, Low" for the rest of the boards 

Thanks for the consideration
fields.summary: Build Priority Schemes for Jira Cloud
Parent/Sub-task relation is not displayed in the issue view on team-managed projects if the issues are imported via JSON or CSV

fields.description:
When I create an EPIC from the roadmap screen below my lowest EPIC in the roadmap screen, I can fill out the topic of the EPIC. This will be filled out in the 'summary' field of the EPIC. Consequently, it automatically auto-copies the content in the 'summary' field into the 'EPIC name' field. GREAT!

However, when I create an EPIC by hitting the create button on the top, it won't copy the content of the 'summary' field into the 'EPIC name' field.

Can the auto-copy feature also be added when people create an EPIC from the top of the screen, so it doesn't confuse the users?
fields.summary: Auto-copy content of field 'Summary' into field 'EPIC name'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When navigating away from a filter, after choosing a different filter from the top navigation bar, the page will still return the results from the previous filter seen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to any issue filter (e.g Filter A)
# Note it'll show correct results
# Navigate away from the issue filter. (e.g. a project board)
# Using the filter drop down from the top navigation bar, navigate to any other favorited filter (e.g Filter B)
# The results stills show Filter A and the results from filter A

h3. Expected Results
It's expected to be shown the results from the selected filter (Filter B).

h3. Actual Results

The issues from Filter A are returned even though Filter B has been selected in the navigation bar.
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filter results returns issues from previous filter seen even after a different one is chosen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Only affects:
 * Jira company-managed (classic) Projects (team-managed (next-gen) has this functionality as a [+feature+|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/enable-and-disable-pages/]).
 * Only affects instances/projects that have the below pop-up when clicking Add item:
!image-2021-03-19-13-06-25-689.png|width=314,height=218!

On Jira Classic projects, after toggling off the Project pages, there is nowhere to add it back on the interface.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the edit button on the Project Page
!image-2021-03-19-13-10-18-135.png|width=236,height=61!
 # Toggle off the Manage Pages menu
!image-2021-03-19-13-13-54-252.png|width=409,height=298!
 # Notice that the row on the left pane is gone. You can still toggle back, but if closing, you are unable to open this pop-up again.
!image-2021-03-19-13-14-26-918.png|width=407,height=294!

h3. Expected Results

There should be a way on the interface to add this again.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to find an option to add it back anywhere.
h3. Workaround

Reach Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Toggling off Project pages on the Project sidebar removes the ability to add it back

fields.description: a good feature to be implemented in Jira would be a way to see which users favorited my dashboards, so when some modification is done, the owner could notificate them
fields.summary: A way to see who favorited my dashboards

fields.description:
Jira for macOS app.

When I type Command + Shift + O on the keyboard, I'd love to see a box that allows me to type or paste a Jira reference into it, so when I press return/enter, I can load and see that Jira issue immediately.

Ideally, the box I enter the reference to should be pre-filled with the issue reference if I have it copied the reference itself or a URL containing one.

Currently using version 127.0.0.
fields.summary: Jira for macOS app: Quick Open to navigate to issues directly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to search epics with Japanese name when we try to add epic to an issue in next-gen project. It occurs only in next-gen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a next-gen project
 # create an epic with Japanese name
 # Create an issue that is not epic
 # Try to add epic to this issue

h3. Expected Results
When we type a Japanese epic name in search box, the suggestion is shown  

h3. Actual Results
When we type a Japanese epic name in search box, the suggestion is not shown  

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to search epics with Japanese name when we try to add epic to an issue in next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving a sub-task to Done in a kanban board, the "Update Parent Issue" pop-up is displayed even if there are sub-tasks opened for the mentioned parent issue, as long as they are not returned by the board filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Kanban project, create a parent issue (Task, Story or Bug)
 # Under that issue, create two sub-tasks
 # Add the component "test" to one of the sub-tasks
 # Edit your board filter to "Project = xyz and component = test", so only one of the sub-tasks above will be displayed
 # Navigate to the Kanban board and move the sub-task to "Done", by dragging and dropping it in the rightmost board column

h3. Expected Results

As there are still open issues under the parent, the "Update Parent Issue" pop-up should not appear.
h3. Actual Results

the "Update Parent Issue" pop-up is displayed.
h3. Workaround

Edit the board filter to display all the sub-tasks under the parent.
fields.summary: The "Update Parent Issue" pop-up is  incorrectly displayed if there are sub-tasks opened out of the board view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Switching screens between the story and bug issue types on agile board causes fields to not display
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Agile Board.
 # Open a story within the board on the card view.
 # Select screen tab and notice the fields in it.
 # Close the Story.
 # Select a Bug and open it to review the fields in the tab.
 # Swap back and forth between stories and bugs and notice the change in the amount of fields shown vs when you don't swap between issue types.

h3. Expected Results

Fields will consistently be displayed the same way regardless if you are switching from a different issue type to another, instead of closing the issue type before opening the other.
h3. Actual Results

Some fields are not displaying properly (they will simply not render)
h3. Workaround

Close the issue card before opening the card for a different issue type or re-open the affected card.
fields.summary: Switching screens between the story and bug issue types on agile board causes fields to not display

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The amount of issue types a Next Gen Project’s can hold is limited to 30. It is defined in the documentation that “You can add up to 30 issue types.”
https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/set-up-issue-types-in-team-managed-projects/
h3. Suggested Solution
The threshold for the max amount of issue types should be higher than 30 or be configurable by site admins.
h3. Workaround
Use Classic Projects instead.
fields.summary: Allow more than 30 issue types in Next Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Modifying the Issue Detail View screen does not maintain the cursor correctly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access from any instance the Board Settings
 # Navigate to the Issue Detail View tab
 # Drag and drop a field and you will see the issue happen:

[^JRACLOUD-76390.webm]

h3. Expected Results
Show the correct frame area when moving the field
h3. Actual Results
Shows the frame below

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Modifying the Issue Detail View screen does not maintain the frame correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The pull request status for some PRs are not updated on the Jira issue. This happens intermittently and does not resolve itself (e.g. if a PR transition is missed it never updates to reflect the current status).

Customer has observed this for PR information in Bitbucket Cloud connected to Jira. It is happening intermittently across multiple issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Bitbucket Cloud to Jira
 # Create a PR in Bitbucket Cloud mentioning an issue in Jira
 # Merge or decline the PR in Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Expected Results

PR status to be reflected in Jira
h3. Actual Results

PR status is not updated in Jira
h3. Workaround

Deleting the recreating the link to Bitbucket Cloud would trigger a re-sync of data. However, this is not recommended for large workspaces or workspaces containing large repositories.
fields.summary: Pull request status not updated on issues

fields.description:
Please increase default width of "Text gadget" in JIRA dashboard. The extremely narrow view makes it very difficult to use it as a medium to type, edit or modify test/HTML contents. It has been an efficiency nightmare for Jira users like me. 

 

Please see attached image explaining the problem.

[link title|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/JIRA-Dashboard-Text-gadget-s-default-width-too-narrow-to-be/qaq-p/1660609#U1661708]
fields.summary: JIRA Dashboard - Text gadget's default width too narrow to be useful

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When dragging and dropping cards under the same column, it can get very slow and freeze when the scrolling part is added to the equation.

We aren't sure yet how many cards are required to reproduce the problem, but we've been seeing it with ~15 issues more in the same column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 [^DragAndDropSlowness.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Actions should be responsive and fast enough

h3. Actual Results
Actions are slow and often freeze

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Drag, scrolling and drop cards under the same column is slow and often freezes

fields.description: In Advanced Roadmap, while working with Grouping, there should be an option to view full hierarchy for an issue.
fields.summary: “Show full hierarchy” on the grouping settings in Advanced Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there are a starred board and project with a quick filter applied, going to issue search section and moving back to the starred project/board the quick filter is not applied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a kanban board
 # Select a quick filter
 # Star the board and the project
 # Go to *Issues > Advanced issue search*
 # Click on the *Search* button
 # Select *Projects* and click on the starred project

Reproducing the problem:  [^bug_quickfilter.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The board should be displayed according to the quick filter applied.

h3. Actual Results
The board doesn't load with the quick filter applied despite the URL is passing it.

h3. Workaround
Just wait a few seconds and the board is automatically updated or refresh the page.
fields.summary: Quickfilter is lost after going to a starred board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is ranked (drag and drop) in the project backlog, the scrolling position of the screen is altered. This causes inconvenience as the users are not able to confirm if the issue has been placed in the correct position in the backlog.

!backlog scroll.gif|width=948,height=531!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Jira project (I used Kanban template for the reproduction)
 * Create about 10 issues in the backlog
 * From board settings, in the card layout config, add upto 3 fields to be displayed in the backlog issues
 * Go back to the backlog, drag and drop the last issue order to 1 or multiple issues up

h3. Expected Results

Users are able to drag and drop issues in the project backlog and are able to confirm the position of the issue placed without the window scrolling position being altered.
h3. Actual Results

The screen scroll position is altered each time an issue is dragged and dropped in the project backlog.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: UI improvement: When an issue rank is changed in the project backlog, the scrolling position of the screen is altered

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

In Advanced Roadmap Plans, you have the option to create [+Saved views+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/preconfigured-views-1019399399.html] that can be managed and used by all users within the Plan and made the default view.

h3. Proposed solution

As an admin, there should be an option in the Manage views to make this default view available on other Plans making it global and not just Plan specific.

 !TST7_SCRUM_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Make saved views available to all Plans

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Automation rules are executed in parallel, which prevents the user to get the benefits of a sequential execution, where he could trigger, for example, multiple Workflow post functions to have the expected result of the first post function be used for the second rule being triggered.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the user the possibility to choose whether he wants the parallel or sequential order for the Automation rules execution
 This could also be extended for not just the THEN clause of the Automations, but also for all automation rules using the same trigger, for example.
fields.summary: Allow switch between parallel and sequential execution of Automation Rules

fields.description:
In looking at which projects share a scheme, workflow, etc, some of those may be archived/inactive.  It may be nice to at least have some sort of indicator in that list that denotes which projects are archived.

 

Go to project setttings -> summary.  click on any scheme or workflow.  click on the hyperlink that will give a list of projects using this scheme or workflow.

!image-2021-04-08-13-56-38-836.png!
fields.summary: Inactive Projects that share a scheme

fields.description:
Now: https://res.cloudinary.com/gperedo/image/upload/v1617904871/Captura_de_pantalla_1_liqioq.png
 !https://res.cloudinary.com/gperedo/image/upload/v1617904871/Captura_de_pantalla_1_liqioq.png!

The solution: https://res.cloudinary.com/gperedo/image/upload/v1617904872/Captura_de_pantalla_2_zwha6f.png

!https://res.cloudinary.com/gperedo/image/upload/v1617904872/Captura_de_pantalla_2_zwha6f.png!
fields.summary: A lot of empty blank and empty space on top of the board

fields.description:
Fix versions field doesn't appear as a choice in the field picker while creating a workflow Rule in Team managed projects.

 !Fix versions field is not available.png|thumbnail! 

It would be very useful to have the "Fix versions" field available as an option.
fields.summary: In Team managed projects, Fix versions field doesn't appear as a choice when creating a workflow rule to update/check an issue's field.

fields.description:
Hi,

In personal card, for a customer, we need more information like phone number, skype id.

Today, only information as a e-mail:

!image-2021-04-08-10-13-26-656.png!

I'm uses Jira Service Management.

Thanks,

Valdemar
fields.summary: Personal Card

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Live Plans does not load if the date at look and feel is using capital letters for days or years

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Look and Feel and update the date from yy to YY

h3. Expected Results
The Live plans should load regardless the look and feel date configuration

h3. Actual Results
The Live Plan doesn't load with the error:
stack: RangeError: Use `dd` instead of `DD` (in `DD/MMM/YY hh:mm A`) for formatting days of the month to the input `Mon Apr 05 2021 00:00:00 GMT-0300 (Brasilia Standard Time)`;

h3. Workaround
Edit the date configuration at look and feel from the capital letters for DD and YY to a lowercase.
fields.summary: Live Plans does not load if the date at look and feel is using capital letters for days or years

fields.description:
Hi,

 

Is there a way we can make use of API's through Jira to automate the work.

for example, if we would like to create a script which actually automates the work that is being requested through Jira or prepopulate the data in Jira by pulling the information from another source.
fields.summary: Integration with other tools using API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira uses a library to parse the timezone of a user and calculate the remaining working days of a sprint. The library was unable to parse a user entered timezone correctly and throwing a status code 500 for board loads.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to account settings
 # Select Account Preference
 # Change your timezone to a custom timezone(ex GMT+3:00). (Do not use the timezones in drop down as they work fine)

h3. Expected Results

The classic boards should load without error. 
h3. Actual Results

The board is throwing a status code 500 while loading.
h3. Workaround

 The workaround is for users to change the timezone to a standard one in their Atlassian account settings.
fields.summary: Jira is unable to parse custom timezone and causing Internal Server Error in classic boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customized parent link field not associated with all issue types on hierarchycal levels in AR, led the parent link relation to stop working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate multiple issue types at different levels in your AR Hierarchy
 # Create at least two custom fields for parent linking
 # Associate one of these cf for one issue type only.

h3. Expected Results

You see the issues under the "Child issues" panel as expected.
h3. Actual Results

On the parent issue, you can't see the child issues panel anymore
h3. Workaround

Check the parent link Custom field and edit its context to be available in any issue type in all projects.
fields.summary: Applying customized "Parent link" fields to only one issue type on its context hides the "Child issues" view in other issue types.

fields.description:
*Current Behavior*

If you create a new issues in the Plan view, you cannot set custom field values (single select drop-down in my case). Because this field we set as required, when publishing we have to set each one, one by one through the popup. It's not ideal.

 

*Expected Behavior*

Creating a new issue in the Plan view allows me to set all of the fields I would be able to set in the Create New screen within the Plan interface.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps: Issue Create should allow to set custom fields

fields.description:
Currently, there is no possible way to differentiate the issues in backlog or board of a nextgen project with Kanban methodology. The status is not sufficed and hence a JQL cannot be used to filter out the issues. 

Steps - 

1) Use a next gen project in Jira
 2) Enable the function "board" and "backlog"
 3) Switch to the backlog per navigation
 3) Create two issues
 4) Move one issue from the lower backlog part to the upper part "board"

5) You can now see one issue being displayed on the board (navigate to board) and one further issue, which is visible in the "backlog" view.

There is no possible way to apply a JQL that can identify the issues in the backlog or board.
fields.summary: A unique label or a way to identify issues that are present in backlog section of nextgen kanban board

fields.description: In Next-gen projects users without manage Sprint permission have the complete Sprint button available, if they click on it and try to complete the Sprint they receive a log-in error without much more information, the complete Sprint button should be greyed out or at least an error about "You don't have permission to complete Sprints" should be displayed.
fields.summary: In Next-gen projects users without manage Sprint permission have the complete Sprint button available

fields.description:
We tried using Workflow editor and custom statuses in our Jira Cloud Next Gen board.

Custom statuses are a great recent addition, but unfortunately we cannot use them, because this will remove the "Add issue" functionality from our board from every column except TODO. It is too much of an overhead to create issues in TODO and drag them manually to the correct column right after creating (our most active column is column no 2 - Planned).

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17434?focusedCommentId=2691987&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2691987

When I try to change this from Workflow editor, I see this message and cannot add any other status than TODO. 

!image-2021-04-05-09-15-25-968.png!
fields.summary: Remove the restriction that tasks can only be created in TODO column, if custom statuses are in use

fields.description:
Provide the ability to translate custom fields in Next Gen Projects.

Also, translation of Custom Field Description would be a plus.
fields.summary: Ability to translate custom fields in Next Gen Projects.

fields.description:
As an Advance Roadmaps user when I share a certain "View" of my Plan to a Confluence Space, if I modify and Save changes to that "View", then the embedded Confluence macro should update to that new view automatically.

Currently when you make and save changes to a certain shared "View" you need to reshare it and get a new link. You then need to update that link in Confluence macro.  This is a huge time suck especially if you have certain views shared a variety of places.
fields.summary: Confluence Shared Views should update automatically

fields.description:
As an Advanced Roadmap user, I want to be able to configure a Plan based on a filter and see the assigned Sprint information and Sprint Dates for the issues that return in that filter so that I can display a Gantt chart for a Project.

Right now, you are required to use the issue source of "Board" and for a project manager who may be managing a project that touches multiple Jira projects or boards, it is tedious to choose each and every board. 

If we could still use a JQL filter to return all the issues in a certain hierarchy, but then still display the Sprints they are assigned to and the bar on the timeline for that sprint (if it has dates), it would be extremely useful.  I would understand that we would not want to allow "scheduling" in this view maybe but at least for display.
fields.summary: Show Sprint info in Plans when not using Issue Source "Board"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Change the issue type during inline ticket creation under backlog will reload the page. However, the issue only happens when you are viewing the backlog and click once again on the Backlog in the side panel. This causes the URL to remove the parameter &issueLimit=100. Once the parameter is removed, if you update the issue type, it will refresh the page to re-add the parameter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Backlog with more than 100 issues.
 # Click once again on Backlog in the side panel.
 # Try to create an issue inline.
 # Change the issue type during the creating.

 * [Video with the behavior|https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApuYyOpK]

h3. Expected Results

It should keep the &issueLimit=100 instead of reloading the page.
h3. Actual Results

It will reload the page to add &issueLimit=100.
h3. Workaround

For now, we can click only once into the Backlog to avoid the parameter into the URL &issueLimit=100 being removed.
fields.summary: Change the issue type during inline ticket creation under backlog will reload the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Swimlanes based on JQLs, if you add parentheses to the search, Jira will remove it after saving it, which causes an inconsistency on the search.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Board Settings > Swimlanes
# Select JQL based swimlanes
# Add a JQL search *with parentheses* and save it

h3. Expected Results
The parentheses should be kept
h3. Actual Results
Jira removes the parentheses from the search
h3. Workaround
Create separated filters and use it on the Swimlanes:
{code}
filter = "filter 1" OR filter = "filter 2"
{code}
fields.summary: Swimlanes based on JQLs remove parentheses when saving it

fields.description:
When a cloud user is added to the site-admin or administrators group they are granted application access. However, they are not automatically added to the confluence-users or jira-software-users groups. 

This may cause problems with any object in Jira or Confluence that uses groups, as users will assume all active users are in the application groups. 

For example if user John Doe is in the administrators group and a filter is shared with the jira-software-users group, John would not have access to the filter.  

*Please disregard the component selected, there was not one for this suggestion.*
fields.summary: Adding users to site-admin or administrators groups does not add them to product user groups

fields.description: The group picker field is currently available in company-managed (formerly classic) projects. Add the ability to team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects as well.
fields.summary: Introduce group picker field in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When closing a sprint in the next-gen project, throws an error saying "Incomplete subtasks" which actually belongs to a different sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and start a sprint in a next-gen project, let's say 'Sprint 3'.
 # Change the issue type of one of the issues from 'Sprint 3' to the *Subtask* issue type and map it under a different parent issue which belongs to say 'Sprint 4'. This sub-task will be mapped under the sprint of its parent issue which is 'Sprint 4' in this case.
 ## Open issue view from the backlog and click on the *Standard* level issue from 'Sprint 3' you want to move. !image-2021-04-01-11-15-39-299.png!
 ## In "Move Issue" flow, change the issue type to be a *Subtask* issue type and select a parent issue that belongs in Sprint 4.  !image-2021-04-01-11-12-36-078.png|width=688,height=362!
 ## See that the issue has gotten successfully moved to be a *Subtask* issue type. The "Sprint" field is "Sprint 4". !image-2021-04-01-11-16-17-495.png!
 # Try to close the 'Sprint 3'.

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to close Sprint 3.
h3. Actual Results

It throws an error saying incomplete sub-task. In this case, it belongs to Sprint 4.

!image-2021-04-01-11-18-41-931.png|width=588,height=486!
h3. Workaround
 * Move the subtask to 'Done' status and then close the Sprint-1. Then re-open the closed subtasks.
fields.summary: Closing sprint in a next-gen project gives error saying incomplete subtasks which belongs to a different sprint.

fields.description: As a user, I would like to be informed where my issues were moved after deleting a sprint, if they were moved to the backlog OR another sprint, and which one.
fields.summary: Display what happened to Issues when deleting a sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Select List (single choice) custom field not showing select options in Roadmap view *if placed on second tab*. It works as a single line multi text field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Select List (single choice) custom field and a few options on it.
 # Place it on the second tab of a screen

h3. Expected Results

Field working as select list, showing its options, as works outside Roadmap view.

!image-2021-03-31-10-25-30-410.png!
h3. Actual Results

Field shown as single line text field:

!image-2021-03-31-10-24-56-584.png!

h3. Workaround

Place this field on the first tab.
fields.summary: Select List (single choice) custom field not showing select options in Roadmap view if placed on second tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to open an unassigned Parent Issue in the Sidebar of an Active Sprint

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*1*. In a Classic Project Board set Swimlanes configuration as Stories in Board Settings
*2*. Create a subtask inside one of the issues and assign it to Person A. The parent issue must be unassigned
*3*. Apply the Avatar filter of Person A, the subtask should show up. Since this is using the Swimlane configuration, the parent issue also shows up even though it is not assigned to Person A.
*4*. Click on Parent Issue which will not open the Sidebar Issue View as we expect it to.

h3. Expected Results
The Parent Issue should open in the Sidebar of the Board

h3. Actual Results
Unable to open an assigned Parent Issue in the Sidebar of the board.

h3. Workaround

First, open the subtask of the Parent Issue in the sidebar, and then from the detail view of the subtask, click the Parent Issue key to open it in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Unable to open an unassigned Parent Issue in the Sidebar of an Active Sprint

fields.description: Please reinstate the option to hide the oldest activity (rather than the newest) when comments are sorted by 'Oldest first' in Detail View.
fields.summary: Hide oldest activity when sorting by 'Oldest first'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using time based estimation means that sprint progress is lost when logging time on issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan that uses day based estimates
 # Use a scrum board as the issue source
 # Create sprints on that board
 # Create some issues on the backlog
 # Set a weekly hours to 200 and iteration length to 3
 # Add an issue to a sprint and give it a 10 days estimate
 # The sprint progress will show 10/75 allocated hours
 # Go to the issue and log 5 hours of work

h3. Expected Results

The sprint fly-out should still show 10/75 allocated hours.
h3. Actual Results

The sprint fly-out now shows 5/75 allocated hours. If you then log the remaining 5 hours and complete the issue it now shows 0/75 hours. This gives the false impression that there is available capacity in the sprint. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Logging time on an issue results in incorrect allocated hours on sprint flyout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a *next-gen project*, when trying to add a label by clicking with the right button on the  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/704577869/704577870/2/1517274795952/ellipsis.png|width=22! right next to the issue name, if you select the label and press enter, the page reloads and does not add it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the project board;
 # On the issue >  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/704577869/704577870/2/1517274795952/ellipsis.png|width=22! > *Add label*;
 # Type the label name > press *Enter* to save (instead of clicking on Done).

[^add-label.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

Label added.
h3. Actual Results

The page reloads and does not add the label.
h3. Workaround

Add the label directly on the issue page.

[^Workaround.mp4]
fields.summary: Pressing enter to add a label on an issue reloads the page

fields.description: Currently, users are unable to sort their Initiatives, Epics & Stories in the Roadmap view by a sequential numbering that would allow a user to input another Initiative, Epic or Story they wish to show in between other already entered Stories.  When a change is identified that adds additional issues to be placed in specific order with already existing issues, it is impossible to get them to sort in that order because the options you provide for sorting do not allow that.
fields.summary: Create more granular sorting and issue placement in Roadmap Views - WYSIWYG Drag and Drop for Building, Viewing, Reporting and Printing

fields.description:
h3. Description

In Jira Software issues, there's a header with the Project / Issue Key. This header remains in place as the user scrolls down through the issue. Same behavior for some other fields, like the Watch button, share, and so on.

However, the *issue summary* and other key fields (e.g Status) aren't present in the non-scrollable header. 
h3. Suggestion

It would be great to have the issue summary in the header and other fields. This is very helpful when the user has multiple browser tabs with different Jira issues in varying states being scrolled down and needs to easily identify the issue.

!image-2021-03-30-15-08-48-319.png|width=727,height=98!
fields.summary: Include issue summary and other "key fields" in the non-scrollable header

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the [*Delete Board*|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-board/#api-agile-1-0-board-boardid-delete] rest API it is possible to delete the board from a *team-managed* project, when doing so, the system allows you to choose the same team managed project to create a classic board and is no longer possible to use it as a board from the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1 - Delete a team managed project board (example below)
{code}
curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}'\
 --user 'your@e-mail.com:api_token'
{code}
2 - Follow the steps to create a classic board (Go to any classic project -> Click on the board drop-down -> Create board)
3 - When prompted choose *Board from an existing project* and point to the *team managed project* from which you deleted the board. And also choose that same project as the *board location*.


h3. Expected Results
We shouldn't be able to create a classic board for a team-managed project. Perhaps it shouldn't even be possible to delete a team-managed board.


h3. Actual Results
The original board is deleted, and whenever you try to access the team-managed project (when you're supposed to land on its board) it doesn't load. 
A generic error is thrown:
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Reach out to Atlassian support
fields.summary: Deleting a team managed (former next-gen) board allows you to create a broken classic board for it.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen Due date in Epics Panel shows one day before the actual due date

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a next-gen activate the backlog feature and create 2 or 3 Epics  
 # In the backlog select the Epic button and turn on the Epics panel
 # Put a due date in one of the Epics, the due date in Epics Panel shows one day before the actual due date
https://share.getcloudapp.com/qGuEp7DQ

h3. Expected Results
The due date should be the same as the issue details

h3. Actual Results
Due date in shows one day before the actual due date

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Next-gen Due date in Epics Panel shows one day before the actual due date

fields.description:
Dear,

we noticed in incorrect translation for "Fix this issue"

WRONG = Deze issue oplossen
CORRECT = Dit issue oplossen
fields.summary: Incorrect Dutch translation for "Fix this issue"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Opening an issue from Dependencies report in Advanced Roadmap plans, causes the entire dependency to remain selected and it is automatically selected in a way that it can be dragged across
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Advanced roadmap plan 
 # Go to Dependencies report and right-click on any issue key to open it in a new tab.
 # Come back to the dependencies report and you will notice that moving the cursor will move the entire dependencies. The boxes are selected and can be dragged - dropped anywhere.
 # This happens only in Chrome.

h3. Expected Results

The dependency should not move with the mouse cursor. 
h3. Actual Results

Shown in screen recording.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: In the dependencies report, right clicking on an issue key makes the report moving around

fields.description: Ability to add sequence property on workflow transition in Nextgen project similar to  *opsbar-sequence* property in classic workflow project.
fields.summary: Ability to add workflow transition sequence property in Nextgen project

fields.description:
Hi,
As mentionned [in this topic|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Hide-transition-in-View-workflow/qaq-p/781478], I would like to hide some transitions in the 'view workflow' panel accessible from any issue in order to make this view clearer and less clutered.
For example, I want the Jira admin to be able to transition issues to every status (with an All transition). Setting up a condition on those transitions hides it from the issue view but not from the "view workflow" pop-up.
Similarly, one of my workflows has a "pending" status which allows all statuses to transition. It also features a backward transition to each 5 other statuses of the workflow, each one of them with a condition so that it is only accessible if the previous status was the one previous to "pending".
All those transitions are actually accessible to the users but you can agree that they cluter the view a lot and it will be all more clear if they were hidden from the view workflow.

Thanks for consideration.
fields.summary: Being able to hide transitions from users in the 'view workflow' popup

fields.description: Currently in all the next-gen projects, the flagged field is added by default in the create issue screen. The user should get an option to hide the field based on their requirement in the create issue screen.
fields.summary: Flagged field in Next-gen

fields.description: In the board settings, when the filter query does not specify any project in particular, if it is going to involve any next-gen projects as well, then we see that the manage sprints permission is not working to "Create sprint". Need to provide the user jira-administrator privilege get it working which is not feasible all the time.
fields.summary: Create sprint does not work as expected when board does not specify project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When dragging a child issue to add it under a parent issue in the Advanced Roadmap, does not work when you have chosen to "Sort by Priority" or any other field -- except for "Rank"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that your Advanced Roadmap is configured in its {{View Settings}} to sort the issues by any other field, than "{{Rank}}" -- let's say Priority
 # Try to drag a Story under an Epic or an Epic under an Initiative
 ## https://share.getcloudapp.com/5zuBpwZX

h3. Expected Results
The issue moves under the parent in the Roadmap view.

h3. Actual Results
No errors are returned, but the Advanced Roadmap does *not* allow you to drag and drop your issues under a parent issue.

No exceptions are seen in the browser console either.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping a child issue to a parent does not work on Advanced Roadmap UI, except when sorted by Rank

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Advanced Roadmap, When creating a subtask from the plan, it tends to pick the team field value from the parent story. Once the changes are reviewed the value disappears.

The subtasks when created out of the plan, does not update the teams field value from the parent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a subtask within a plan
 # You can see that the subtask picked the teams field value from parent. 
 # However on reviewing the changes, it would go back to None. 

h3. Expected Results

The subtask should inherit the value from the parent.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-03-29-12-38-15-647.png|width=342,height=149!
h3. Workaround

Use automation for Jira to update the field value.
fields.summary: Subtasks do not reflect the parent's team field value

fields.description: Because subtasks by definition are a part of their parent task, if their parent has an epic link then the subtasks should also be linked to that epic. It would be great if views that display epic links would display subtasks' parents' epic link in that field instead of always being blank.
fields.summary: Subtasks should display the epic link of their parent task

fields.description:
As a company, we don't want the Atlassian Users to see the concrete name of the Reporter and the Assignee on the ticket.
Also when we talk about Confluence, we don't want to show the user's details when setting the permissions for a page or space. Instead of showing the user's detail, I want to show the company's name.

** In short, when a user submits a ticket into Jira XYZ (lets say from company ABC), the reporter name should get updated with the reporter's company, which is ABC, and similarly, when someone from XYZ responds, the user should see XYZ as the author.
fields.summary: Ability to hide the users in confluence and JIRA Software

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary

Currently, the "*+ Create issue*" option is greyed out in a Plan when using the following [_Group by_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/group-issues-998651089.html] options in the *View settings*:
* Sprint
* Release
* Label
* Component

h3. Proposed solution

Enable the "*+ Create issue*" button when the Plan is using any Group by option.
fields.summary: Ability to create issues when issues are grouped by component/label

fields.description:
h3. Problem
 Currently the List- new feature in available only for classic business projects in Jira.

h3. Suggested Solution
Would be nice to use this feature on other project types as well. Please make it available for classic software projects and other types of projects.

h3. Why This Is Important
Would be nice to use this feature on other project types as well

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: List -New feature availability for Classic Software and other types of projects in Jira

fields.description: Add Plans to the Projects Hierarchy on the left side of the window so I can toggle to it from one screen.
fields.summary: Add Plans Link to Left Nav in Projects

fields.description: Can’t put a start and end date into an issue unless I have saved it already.  Creates unnecessary steps for me to get the schedule built.  The system should allow me to make all the edits, show me the impact as I work, then allow me to commit or remove anything I don’t want to commit.  If I have to commit every time I make a change to see the overall impact that kind of defeats the purpose.  Scenarios are a good answer for major updates or adding a Change Order but not for building and getting something going.
fields.summary: Allow Start/End Date entry before saving on Advanced Roadmaps Plan

fields.description: Dependencies between tasks/issues is weak or nonexistent in most cases I would need them.  Concurrent starts with lags is very important in our work and not sure it’s really showing the reality of how the work is performed.
fields.summary: Enhance Issue Dependencies in Advanced Roadmaps Plan

fields.description: Fill down of dates would be helpful in the roadmap area, it helps me build a schedule quickly.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps Plan - Date Fill Down

fields.description: Spawning new windows to drill into the different views is a time waster, I have to go to different windows/tab instead of working in the same window/tab.
fields.summary: Spawning new Windows - Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description: Auto refresh the all views when a commit or update is made – this again slows me down when I want to see the impact of an added epic, story or issue immediately.
fields.summary: Auto Refresh views

fields.description: It would be great if you give the ability to autosave and commit changes in the Roadmap view.  Having to save all my changes slows me down significantly when building schedules.
fields.summary: Autosave Changes in Advanced Roadmaps Plan View
Structure: Offer a way to save your column widths to the view
Structure: Activate Automation Mode as the Default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you work inside a board and transition an issue in the pop-up screen if you wait around 2 seconds and close the pop-up by clicking in the "X" or clicking on the board it will auto-refresh but if you close the pop-up immediately after doing the transition the auto-refresh does not work and a manual refresh is needed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Open an issue in the pop-up view 
- Transition it and immediately click back on the board to close the screen
- See the video below with some examples.
https://share.getcloudapp.com/DOuDnpv4

h3. Expected Results
The board auto-refresh

h3. Actual Results
The refresh never happens

h3. Workaround
Wait 2 seconds before closing the pop-up or do a manual refresh
fields.summary: Board auto refresh does not work if a transition is done in a pop-up screen and immediately is closed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Subtasks are not inheriting the custom field value from Team field.
This happens with any issue type of the subtask type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan in Advanced Roadmaps
 # Create a team
 # Create a Story
 # Create a child issue as a subtask
 # Select the value for the field Team in the parent issue

h3. Expected Results
Subtasks should inherit the Team value from their parent issue

h3. Actual Results
Subtasks don't inherit the Team value from their parent issue

h3. Workaround
None as the field is not editable in subtask issue types.
A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Subtasks are not inheriting the custom field value from Team field

fields.description:
I'd like Jira Cloud to have this feature:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Can-I-auto-link-to-a-Version-number-from-a-comment-or/qaq-p/1646590]
fields.summary: Add ability to link to a Version entry in Description or comment.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Auto-scheduling doesn’t handle crossing end of year correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Add some epics (around 12)
 # Add a story points value for them and for the last ones set 13 as the value
 !screen_shot_2021-03-12_at_1.58.45_pm.png|thumbnail! 
 # Auto-schedule selecting *All values* for each column there.

h3. Expected Results
The timeline should be rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
13/14 points is the threshold that pushes it either side of the boundary

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Auto-scheduling doesn’t handle crossing end of year correctly

fields.description:
During the phase of development on one of our backlog items it often occurs that we need to re-estimate our stories/tasks as new facts impacting the effort of the task or requirements change.

This means changing the story points of the item. Whenever we do this, however, we lose the previous story point estimation and thus the ability to track how story points have changed and how our sprint velocity was affected.

I believe Jira already offers estimation-change history for time estimates. Since we would prefer to stick to story point estimates, I think it would be very useful to add such a tracking feature there as well.
fields.summary: Add ability to track history of story points

fields.description:
This issue here is about a basic (small) but necessary improvement: don't show users who don't have access to jira as option under Jira projects!

At this moment, it's possible to select Portal Only customer as Board Admins for JSW boards. This won't give them access/visibility do the board, but it's a misleading information for site-admins, since it seems these users do have access to Jira itself as they appear as option to be admins in a JSW Board.
fields.summary: Don't allow Portal Only Customers who don't have Jira application access to appear as option in Board Admins list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the 'View documentation' link is redirecting the user to ['Page Not Found'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdvancedRoadmapsCloud/Getting+started] error instead of [the correct page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/get-started-with-advanced-roadmaps-998650919.html]

*Note*: this ticket is created based on [https://jira-feedback.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-25072] customer feedback.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the cogwheel icon
 # Click on 'Get started'
 # Follow all the steps till the end
 # In the end, a tooltip flag is shown including the 'View documentation' link
 # Click on the link

h3. Expected Results

Redirect to the correct documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/get-started-with-advanced-roadmaps-998650919.html
h3. Actual Results

It redirects to an error page with 'Page Not Found', https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdvancedRoadmapsCloud/Getting+started
h3. Workaround

The correct link is suggested in the 'Page Not Found' error page and the user can use it for now.
fields.summary: 'View documentation' link at the end of 'Get started' tour is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an inline issue, if the backlog's filtering out an issue type using 'AND NOT issuetype' syntax, it only allows users to create issues +within+ the issue type that was +filtered out.+
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Filter a backlog query to not show certain issue types by using the 'AND NOT' syntax. Example:
{quote}project = SCRUM AND NOT issuetype in (Story, bug)
{quote}
 # When creating an inline issue in the backlog, it only allows you to create an issue from the issue type that was filtered out (story, bug).
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-22 at 14.38.56.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Creating an inline issue should allow users to create issue types available within the board.
h3. Actual Results

Creating an inline issue is only allowing users to create issues that have been filtered out of the board view by the 'AND NOT' syntax.
h3. Workaround
 # On the backlog page:
 # Click *More options* > *Board settings*
 #  Go to *Edit Filter Query*, under Filter
  # Change the JQL query from 'AND NOT issuetype IN' to 'AND issuetype NOT IN'
fields.summary: Inline Issue creation is not allowing issue creation if the query's negative operator is placed before the issue type

fields.description:
The section name *Issues completed outside of sprint* in burndown report should be renamed in a better way since it gives an impression that it will display all the issues that do not belong to the sprint and were marked as Done during the sprint duration (between the start and end date). 

The actual functionality is that would include issues that were added to a sprint and the completion date of the issues is before the sprint start date.

 

Probably the below improvements would help it make more precise -
 - Rename the existing report section to be *Issues completed before sprint start*
 - Add a new section *Issues completed without sprint* to show any issues that are resolved without being a part of a sprint so that the sprint team can review any work being done that isn't assigned to the sprint process.
fields.summary: Burndown Report section should be renamed - Issues completed before sprint rather than outside sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Customer was unable to see the statuses of transitions available in the dropdown and it simply said- "You don't have permission to transition this issue". 
The actual problem was associated to a condition set in the workflow, where the assignee and component field needs to be filled in.

h3. Suggested Solution
 A clearer message like " You are blocked by the conditions in the workflow"  is better.

h3. Why This Is Important
A better message with clear information would help the customer to look at the right place for the solution. This helps them to save time.
Due to the unclear message, customer is confused and have to depend on support to troubleshoot and identify the issue.

h3. Workaround
Open a case with support to troubleshoot and know more details on the issue
fields.summary: Need a clear/better error message pointing to the problem when having issues with workflows

fields.description:
Hi

Is there an API to get all *Azure pull-request* from JIRA.

earlier We use `/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/detail?issueId=812815&*applicationType=stash*&dataType=pullrequest` which return PRs info from stash.

 

I want an API that will return all pull requests that are raised in Azure. I guess we need to change `*applicationType=stash` to `azure`* or there is an another API end point
fields.summary: Provide a public REST API endpoint to get Azure development info associated with an issue
Provide a public REST API endpoint to get Azure development info associated with an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We do not want to see users in the dropdown who are not part of the issue security. Our users tend to @mention users those who are not part of the Issue security level which does not notify that person and creates confusion.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please restrict the user search list based on the roles/groups set in the Issue security level or at least show some warning that the user will not be notified because of the issue security.
h3. Why this is important

Users are not aware if the issue is locked for others and they try to @mention the unintended users. As an admin, i would like to restrict that to avoid unnecessary confusion.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict @mention users only from the specific Security level when the Issue security is applied

fields.description: In the old issue view when you created a new child issue from within an epic and a creation screen popped up you could change the destination project and the Epic link field remained with the value of the originating epic. This is not the case in the new issue view and if you follow the same procedure you have to select the Epic link value again after changing the destination project as the field is reset.
fields.summary: Retain the epic link field value when an issue is created from within an epic and a different project is selected

fields.description:
Advanced Roadmap -

When exporting the Plan to a CSV file under the Advanced Roadmap feature, the file doesn't have the field Parent issue key or link in it.

As a Portfolio user, I would want the Parent issue key or link to be included in the CSV export.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the CSV export feature to include the Parent issue key or link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After deleting the sprint the plan does not load

h3. Expected Results
The plan should load after deleting a sprint

h3. Actual Results
The plan does not load after deleting a sprint

h3. Workaround
* Go to plan configuration page by replacing `#plan/backlog` with `#settings/scheduling`
* Modify planning capacity t another unit and then update it back to the original unit
* Go back to the plan and it will load correctly
fields.summary: After deleting the sprint the plan does not load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Story points are not shown on card layout only on Backlog

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View an issue from the Backlog with Story Points value
 # View same issue from the Active Sprint page

h3. Expected Results
Show same value from Story points

h3. Actual Results
Story point field has no value

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Story points are not shown on card layout only on Backlog

fields.description:
Why is it that the issue navigator columns persist across all queries? Not all queries need the same fields. It seems to me it would be a lot better if every query had its own set of columns to display, and not try to shoehorn in all the queries into the same displayed columns. 

When a large enterprise has dozens of teams with a swarm of projects, the number of fields with similar names proliferates. On my team, we have 2027 fields total on all our tickets, and each project has over 1500 columns.  Over 30 of them have the word 'Status' in them, which makes it impossible to select just the 'Status' system column, since it cuts off after only a few options in the dropdown, and asks me to 'type more' to get more specific, but when the field I want is just called 'status' there is no more to type.  

Why not make each query focus only on the ticket types available for a given user, and not for an entire enterprise? If 95% of all columns are irrelevant to the active project, why show any of those? They cause clutter, and are burdensome to filter out or get around, especially if they push basic fields out of reach entirely.
fields.summary: JIRA navigator displayed columns issues

fields.description:
JQL provides a 'WAS operator' for a (very) limited number of fields.

I think it's a very strong addition to have this operator for start/due date fields.

Scenario:
 * Initiatives (or any other issue types) get planned as part of quarterly planning sessions
 * Looking back in time (e.g. during Q2) I want to be able to see:
 ** All issues which (on 31/12) had a planned due date during Q1
 ** Out of these issues, which ones actually got their status moved to Done by 1/4
 * I want to run this kind of report (or build this as a dashboard) quarterly to:
 ** set a KPI (something like quarterly 'realistic delivery rate')
 ** determine a trend on this KPI (I want to move up my 'predictability')
 ** link/categorize issue not delivered as planned to 'route cause categories'
 ** come up with improvements to target specific 'route causes'
 ** Continuously measure and learn
 * Vizualizing the above on a 'time stamped roadmap view' would be a great help as well:
 ** Confluence page with an embedded (Jira Advanced) Roadmap view showing the Roadmap as how it looked on (e.g.) 31/12 next to how it looked on (e.g.) 1/4
 ** For this page you would get a 'human' view on how the Roadmap was plotted before the quarter started and what was actually delivered by quarter end.
fields.summary: JQL 'WAS operator' on start/date date fields

fields.description:
*Concern* -

 The Team edit will accept “*0*” as the *Sprint velocity* but outside of this view, it reverts back to “*30*". If I look at the Sprint capacity on the timeline, I see it’s taking into account the “*30*” and not “*0*" so it looks like it can’t accept *0 pts* for the capacity planning. Meanwhile, with the new “Sprint level capacity” function, it actually can function with *0 pts* but I have to edit this directly in the capacity window.

It displays “0” on edit mode but the actual value is “30".

To reproduce, kindly have a look at the screen-recording.

*Actual behaviour -* 

As soon as we come out of the edit mode, it looks like 0 is replaced with 30.

*Expected behaviour -*

Sprint velocity should show 0 value outside the edit mode.

*Workaround* -

As a workaround, you can set the capacity to 0 manually on the sprint. The only setback with this is that this is on a sprint level so you would have to do it for every sprint.
fields.summary: The Team edit will accept “0” as the Sprint velocity but outside of this view, it reverts back to “30"

fields.description:
In advanced search, only issues with issue type Sub-task list's parents and issues with issue type Story lists Epic links.
Hence it is not possible to list the parent issues for issue type Story and Task in the advanced search filter and these issue types are only filtered using the Epic link.
fields.summary: Advanced search filter does not list "Parent" fields for issue type "Task" and "Story"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In next-gen project, when you move an issue/card from one status to the other, it shows as if the transition was successful however, it goes back to the previous status immediately. You will have to try to transition the issue couple of times to get the card mapped to the status correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Note: Not reproducible in all instances.
 # Create a next-gen project with an issue.
 # Move the issue from one status to other. Eg- "In progress" to "Done"
 # You will see that the card gets highlighted in green showing as if this transition was successful. However, within seconds, the card goes back to the previous status which is "In progress" from "Done"

h3. Expected Results
- Once a card is moved/transitioned from one to another, it should be successful.

h3. Actual Results
- The card/issue flips back to the same previous status from where the card was transitioned.

h3. Workaround
- With multiple tries, you will be able to move/transition the issue successfully.
fields.summary: Transitioning cards from one status to the other in next-gen reverts the card to the previous status and needs a couple of retries to succeed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After accessing the link of a deleted board, if users access a software project they are no redirected to an existing board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the board link and delete it
 # Paste the link on browser and hit enter
# Click on *Projects* and then on any software project
# Error "Board not found" is displayed even if the project has a board

h3. Expected Results
The project's board is loaded

h3. Actual Results
Jira throws "Board not found" error

h3. Workaround
Copy the project link, paste the link on another browser tab and hit enter.
After these steps the issue should no longer be reproducible.
fields.summary: Users are redirected to deleted board

fields.description: As a user, I like compact views, so that I can use more of my screen. However, collapsing the sidebar currently completely hides it. This makes it impossible to navigate without opening the entire sidebar again. Collapsing the sidebar so that only the icons are visible would keep a compact view, but retain the possibility to navigate. Descriptions of icons could be shown through tooltips in this mode.
fields.summary: Sidebar: collapse to icons only

fields.description:
We have two fields in our Jira Cloud instance, "Original Estimate" and "Time Tracking: (Hours) Remaining". In the web UI, I can edit and set both. In the mobile Jira Android app, however, only one labeled "Time Estimate" shows and is editable, and updating it actually updates the "Original Estimate" field. Another label, "Original estimate" shows under "More," but there is no value, and it is not editable.

I don't know whether this is a pair of custom fields in our instance or what. I just know I cannot report "time remaining" at the end of the day via mobile app :)
fields.summary: Mobile Jira app on Android: Remaining vs Original Estimate fields appear to be swapped and partially editable

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Unable to clone issues including the sub-tasks that have a value on the Advanced Roadmaps Team field and sub-tasks.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Having a story that is part of an Advanced Roadmaps plan, assign a Team to it.
# Create sub-tasks on the story
# Click on the *meatballs (...)* menu  within the issue view and select to *Clone* the issue.

h4. Expected results
Issue is cloned with its child issues.

h4. Actual results
An error is thrown, issues are not cloned.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

{code}Can't clone this issue. Editability check for setting Portfolio team field failed{code}

h3. Workaround
If possible, temporarily clear the Team field, clone the issue and re-apply the configuration on the Advanced Roadmaps plan.

h3. Notes
Issues +without sub-tasks+ and a +value on the Team field+ do not reproduce the problem, as well as issues +with sub-tasks+ but the +Team field is empty+.
fields.summary: Unable to clone issues including the sub-tasks that have a value on the Advanced Roadmaps Team field and sub-tasks
